title: Course Policy
text:
Grading Scheme



Component
Weight
Notes




Homework
30%
Weekly assignments, lowest score dropped.


Midterm
30%
In-class, open notes.


Final Exam
40%
Comprehensive.





Collaboration Policy
You are encouraged to discuss problem sets with classmates, but you must write up your own solutions. Copying code or derivations is not allowed.


Resources

Textbook: Feedback Control of Dynamic Systems, Franklin, Powell, Emami-Naeini (8th Ed).
Software: We will use Python (NumPy, SciPy, Matplotlib) for all computational assignments.

title: EE380: Control Systems
text:
Spring 2026 | Instructor: Prof. [Name]
EE380 introduces the analysis and design of feedback control systems. We will cover modeling of physical systems, stability analysis, and controller design techniques (PID, Root Locus, Bode Plots).






NoteFast Links




Calendar - Weekly schedule and slides
Homework - Assignments and solutions
Syllabus - Grading and course policies







Welcome to the course! Please review the Syllabus and install Python if you plan to run simulations locally. The first homework is posted.

title: Instructor Guide: EE380 Course Website
text:
This website is built with Quarto. It uses GitHub Pages for hosting and Pyodide for interactive Python simulations.





Create a new repository on GitHub (e.g., ee380-website).
Clone this folder to your machine.
Push this initial code to the main branch.





Install Quarto: Download from quarto.org.
VS Code: Recommended editor. Install the “Quarto” extension.
Install Pyodide Extension: Open a terminal in this folder and run: bash     quarto add quarto-ext/shinylive     # OR for standard pyodide     quarto add coatless-quarto/pyodide (Note: The current template assumes standard code blocks initially. To use the interactive features, you must install the extension.)








Open calendar.qmd.
Add new rows to the table for the upcoming week.
Link slides (put PDF files in a slides/ folder if you like, or link externally).





Open homework.qmd.
Add a new row to the table.
Link the PDF assignment.




To publish, you just need to push to GitHub. The Setup is already configured (see .github/workflows/publish.yml).
git add .
git commit -m "Update week 3 schedule"
git push
Within nearly 60 seconds, your site at https://<username>.github.io/<repo> will update.




Once the Pyodide extension is installed, you can add interactive cells like this:
```{pyodide-python}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
plt.plot(x, np.sin(x))
plt.show()
```
This will render as an interactive, editable, regular Python cell in the student’s browser.
